remarks: If every term in one finite sum is less than the corresponding term in another, then the first sum is less than the second.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jun-2014.)
statement:
fsumlt.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. Fin ) $.
fsumlt.2 $e |- ( ph -> A =/= (/) ) $.
fsumlt.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> B e. RR ) $.
fsumlt.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> C e. RR ) $.
fsumlt.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> B < C ) $.
fsumlt $p |- ( ph -> sum_ k e. A B < sum_ k e. A C ) $.
$d A k $.
$d k ph $.
